main event: Two witnesses observed a bright amber, oval-shaped object approximately 40-50 feet in diameter that hovered and moved up and down slowly over Knollwood, Ohio on June 17, 1955. The object was observed for around 15 minutes before vanishing in an easterly direction.
interesting points: The object was observed both visually and by radar, but pilots did not intercept or positively identify it.
The object stopped, hovered, and then departed rapidly to the west, disappearing from radar.
A second observation of the same or a similar object was made by a different witness on June 7, 1955.
The sighting was confirmed by a C-119 pilot report on June 22, 1955 in the same area.
The witnesses were deemed reliable, and no further investigation was recommended.
sighted object: a bright amber, oval-shaped object approximately 40-50 feet in diameter
